0.user_question: The Razorback shop makes $ 86 dollars off each t-shirt and $ 232 off each jersey. During the Arkansas and Texas tech game they sold 254 t-shirts and 43 jerseys. How much more does a jersey cost than a t-shirt?

ost_step.1: The profit from selling one t-shirt is $86.
ost_step.2: The profit from selling one jersey is $232.
ost_step.3: To find out how much more a jersey costs than a t-shirt based on their profits alone, we subtract the profit per t-shirt from the profit per jersey.

direct_answer.text:
To calculate the difference in profit between selling one jersey and one t-shirt, subtract the profit per t-shirt ($86) from the profit per jersey ($232). 

So, $232 (profit per jersey) - $86 (profit per t-shirt) = $146.

The answer is: The jersey costs $146 more than a t-shirt based on the profit made from each sale.
